title: How to Drop a Stack of Items in Minecraft

steps.title: Select the stack of items to be dropped.
steps.content: Select the stack of items to be dropped. To do so, press the number on your keyboard corresponding to the stack of items you would like to drop to select them.

steps.title: Press “Ctrl” on your keyboard and simultaneously press “Q.
steps.content: Press “Ctrl” on your keyboard and simultaneously press “Q. ” This will drop the entire stack of items in front of you.

steps.title: Press “E.
steps.content: Press “E. ” This will open up your inventory.

steps.title: Select the items.
steps.content: Select the items. Left-click on the stack of items that will be dropped.

steps.title: Drag the stack outside the inventory.
steps.content: Drag the stack outside the inventory. “Outside” includes all of the darkened gray area on the screen surrounding the inventory window.

steps.title: Left-click again.
steps.content: Left-click again. This will drop the items on the ground in front of you.

steps.title: Press “E.
steps.content: Press “E. ” This will open up your inventory.

steps.title: Locate the stack of items you wish to drop.
steps.content: Locate the stack of items you wish to drop. Afterwards, hover over it with the mouse; do NOT click.

steps.title: Hold “Ctrl” and press “Q.”
steps.content: Hold “Ctrl” and press “Q.” When you exit your inventory, you will see the stack of items in front of you. As a beginner, you can try the game before buying it. [1] X Research source There are several Minecraft free trials available for PC and Xbox users. [2] X Research source You can even use the demo version of Minecraft. [3] X Research source
